metadata.title: CVE-2024-1151 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Open vSwitch sub-component in the LinuxKernel. The flaw occurs when a recursive operation of code push recursivelycalls into the code block. The OVS module does not validate the stackdepth, pushing too many frames and causing a stack overflow. As a result,this can lead to a crash or other related issues.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-1151` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
